body_content.explanation: an isosceles triangle (= one with two sides of equal length) in which the two sides of equal length are in the golden ratio (= a mathematical relationship of approximately 1 to 1.6 that is often found in nature and art) to the other side:
examples: An example layout is shown in Figure 12 that consists of two golden triangles.
What is the size of the smallest angle of the golden triangle?

body_content.explanation: a rule of artistic composition (= the way that things or people are arranged in a painting or photograph) according to which an image can be divided using diagonal lines into four triangles of different sizes:
examples: One way to use the golden triangle is to place your subject directly along the diagonals.
You can use a road that cuts through your frame at a diagonal to produce a golden triangle composition.

body_content.explanation: an area of southeast Asia that is known for producing opium (= a drug made from the seeds of a poppy that is used to control pain, help sleep, or illegally for pleasure):
examples: He travels the border region between Thailand, Laos, and Myanmar known as the Golden Triangle.

body_content.explanation: an area, usually approximately triangular in shape, that is known as being an especially good place to live, have a business, produce a particular thing, etc.:
examples: Good village schools make this area, known locally as the Golden Triangle, popular with young families.
This is an outstanding wine from the "golden triangle" of Spanish wine production.
